metadata.title: CVE-2016-2853 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description: The aufs module for the Linux kernel 3.x and 4.x does not properly restrictthe mount namespace, which allows local users to gain privileges bymounting an aufs filesystem on top of a FUSE filesystem, and then executinga crafted setuid program.

criterions.comment: linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gke-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gcp-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
